title: Getting game data externally
body:
Hi,

is there any way to get client data of your own player like health, gold or cooldowns?
I want to use that data to create a custom color profile for my rgb keyboard.

replies.body:
http://i.giphy.com/QwH7v7J1tBrq0.gif

TBH, most programs will have to do some pretty awkward data collection in order to get the info it needs to do something like this. It's not to say it can't be done, but I'd be a little worried about our system detecting that data collection as being a [**malicious third party program**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848). If you search something like League Stats and keyboard colors, you should be able to find some helpful tips, but do be careful and make sure to read over that third party faq.

I know this isn't quite the answer we were looking for here, but I'd hate to help you get this working only for it to be detected as something harmful to the game.

I know there must be some way that it works as the Alienware Command Center integrates with both pings and health in client. I don't have any information as to if that's an agreement Dell worked out with Riot or if it's available to the general public - I'd imagine that it'd be controlled in *some* manner, but in what way I don't know.

Hopefully we can attract Broporo or another H+Ser here to get you a link for this!
